definition: a possible period of want or need

sentences.english: The government keeps a certain stock of money and grain for emergency needs.
sentences.chinese: 国家对钱粮都有一定的库存，以备不时之需。

sentences.english: He laid up some money for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 积蓄一些钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: We should save some food against unexpected needs.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该节省一些粮食，以备不时之需。

sentences.english: You'd better set aside some money for special use.
sentences.chinese: 你最好留一些钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: She squirrels away any extra money for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 她把额外的钱都存起来，以备不时之需。

sentences.english: I'll keep her address in case I need it.
sentences.chinese: 我会保留她的地址以备不时之需。

sentences.english: We should lay up some money for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 我们应存一点钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: My mother taught us always to save some money for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 母亲总是告诫我们要攒一些钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: Take a spare tyre along in case of need.
sentences.chinese: 带只备用轮胎去，以备不时之需。

sentences.english: We all need some savings against a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 我们都需要储蓄一些钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: Some of them are careful enough to have a little nest egg tucked away for the rainy days.
sentences.chinese: 一些人比较谨慎，储起一点闲钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: He is planning to amass a fortune for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 他正打算积蓄财富以备不时之需。

sentences.english: I leave the book at hand for use when necessary.
sentences.chinese: 我把这本书放在手边，仅仅是以备不时之需。

sentences.english: I have some money staked out for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 我存了点钱，以备不时之需。

sentences.english: Let's be on the safe side and take nore money than we think we'll need.
sentences.chinese: 我们还是要保险些，多带点钱以备不时之需。

sentences.english: Some money should be saved up for emergency needs.
sentences.chinese: 应该存些钱以备不时之需。

definition: Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
to put to good use/to come in handy
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
have sth ready just in case/keep sth for possible future use
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
(so as) to avoid/to prevent/(just) in case
